title: 111_s345
content:
The Act titled "Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2009" expands its scope to include coral conservation, amending the previous Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998. This expansion aims to protect both forests and coral reefs. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems in its scope. The Act aims to protect both forests and coral reefs. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems in its scope. Amendments involve replacing "tropical forests" with "areas" and "tropical forests and coral reefs and their associated coastal marine ecosystems," as well as changing "that have led to deforestation" to "on such countries." Amendments related to definitions also include adding "coral reef" alongside "tropical forest" in various sections. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems. The term "coral" is defined to include various species of corals, and "coral reef" is defined as any reef primarily composed of coral. The term "associated coastal marine ecosystem" refers to any coastal marine ecosystem related to a coral reef. The term "associated coastal marine ecosystem" refers to any coastal marine ecosystem surrounding or related to a coral reef, such as seagrasses, mangroves, and sandy seabed communities. SEC. 4. CHANGE TO NAME OF FACILITY.

Section 804 of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename "Tropical Forest Facility" to "Conservation Facility". Conforming amendments are made to definitions in Section 803(8) of the Act.

SEC. 5. ELIGIBILITY FOR BENEFITS.

Section 805(a) of the Act is amended to include eligibility for benefits related to tropical forest or coral reef conservation. SEC. 6. United States government representation on oversight bodies for grants from debt-for-nature swaps and debt buybacks. One or more individuals appointed by the United States Government may serve on the administering body overseeing grants from debt-for-nature swaps or debt buybacks, regardless of U.S. involvement in agreements. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename agreements and eliminate the requirement to consult with the Enterprise for the Americas Board. The role of beneficiary countries is also revised to improve governance and enhance management of tropical forests or coral reefs in limited circumstances. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to improve governance and management of tropical forests, coral reefs, and associated coastal marine ecosystems in beneficiary countries. Grants over $250,000 require approval from the US and beneficiary country governments. Technical amendments include specifying the purpose of grants and expanding the scope to include coral reefs and marine ecosystems. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to improve governance and management of tropical forests, coral reefs, and associated coastal marine ecosystems in beneficiary countries. Amendments include changing references from "tropical forest" to "coral reef and related resources" to align with conservation efforts. Conforming amendments update definitions to reflect the focus on conservation agreements rather than specific forest agreements. Amendments include changing references from "tropical forest" to "coral reef and related resources" to align with conservation efforts. Conforming amendments update definitions to reflect the focus on conservation agreements rather than specific forest agreements. SEC. 8. CONSERVATION FUND. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to change references from "tropical forest" to "conservation fund" and "conservation agreement" to align with conservation efforts. Conforming amendments update definitions to reflect the focus on conservation agreements and funds. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to change references from "tropical forest" to "conservation fund" in specific sections. SEC. 9 repeals the authority of the Enterprise for the Americas Board to carry out activities under the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009. SEC. 10 makes changes to the due dates of annual reports to Congress. SEC. 10 amends the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 by changing the due dates of annual reports to Congress to April 15 and updating terminology. Subsection (b) is removed. SEC. 11 amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 regarding the International Monetary Fund criterion for country eligibility. It removes certain language and updates criteria for eligibility. SEC. 12 authorizes appropriations for debt reduction and audit, evaluation, monitoring, and administration expenses. SEC. 12 authorizes new appropriations for debt reduction and audit, evaluation, monitoring, and administration expenses, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 2009 to 2012.
